title: What is the Madrid tennis schedule?
description: The Mutua Madrid Open continues on Friday, when top seed and two-time champion Alexander Zverev headlines the action. Fresh from winning his first trophy of the season at the ATP 500 in Munich, Zverev takes on Roberto Bautista Agut in the third match scheduled on Manolo Santana Stadium. Andrey Rublev will then begin his title defence against Gael Monfils in the first evening-session clash, with the seventh seed leading the Frenchman 3-1 in their Lexus ATP Head2Head series. Top 10 stars Taylor Fritz, Holger Rune and Daniil Medvedev will also all start their campaigns on Friday. Fritz takes on Christopher O’Connell on Stadium 3, while Medvedev faces Laslo Djere, and Rune battles Flavio Cobolli on Arantxa Sanchez Stadium. #NextGenATP stars Jakub Mensik and Federico Cina are in action on Court 6. Cina takes on 23rd seed Sebastian Korda, and Mensik will follow against qualifier Ethan Quinn. View Friday’s full order of play below. html:
Madrid

Top seed Zverev, defending champ Rublev play on Friday

April 24, 2025

Getty Images

The 2025 Mutua Madrid Open will be held from 23 April-4 May. By ATP Staff

The Mutua Madrid Open continues on Friday, when top seed and two-time champion Alexander Zverev headlines the action.

Fresh from winning his first trophy of the season at the ATP 500 in Munich, Zverev takes on Roberto Bautista Agut in the third match scheduled on Manolo Santana Stadium. Andrey Rublev will then begin his title defence against Gael Monfils in the first evening-session clash, with the seventh seed leading the Frenchman 3-1 in their Lexus ATP Head2Head series.

Top 10 stars Taylor Fritz, Holger Rune and Daniil Medvedev will also all start their campaigns on Friday. Fritz takes on Christopher O’Connell on Stadium 3, while Medvedev faces Laslo Djere, and Rune battles Flavio Cobolli on Arantxa Sanchez Stadium.

#NextGenATP stars Jakub Mensik and Federico Cina are in action on Court 6. Cina takes on 23rd seed Sebastian Korda, and Mensik will follow against qualifier Ethan Quinn.

View Friday’s full order of play below.

Read more from Madrid:
Djokovic: 'The sport will outlive everyone'
Fonseca sets showdown with Paul
Alcaraz withdraws from Madrid
Nishikori earns 450th win

ORDER OF PLAY - FRIDAY, 25 APRIL 2025

Not Before 8:00 PM
